author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 14,971 students in Puducherry and 3,039 students in Karaikal will appear for the Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) examinations commencing on March 15. The examinations will go on till April 11.

A release issued by the Directorate of School Education said that in Puducherry, a total of 7,389 boys and 7,582 girls from 239 higher secondary schools would appear for the SSLC examinations.

The examinations are being conducted in 37 centres in Puducherry.

As many as 1,317 candidates are taking the Class X examinations as private candidates, the release said.

Supervisors appointed

A total of 820 examination supervisors have been appointed. Seven flying squads comprising five members in each squad have been formed under the supervision of the Chief Education Officer (CEO) to prevent malpractices.

In the Karaikal region, a total of 1,458 boys and 1,581 girls are appearing for the SSLC examinations from 59 higher secondary schools.

A total of 455 candidates would sit for the examinations as private candidates. A total of 172 supervisors have been appointed and flying squads with four members have been formed.
title: SSLC exams to begin from March 15
